document_data.mainbody:
'''Chessenta''' was a confederation of city-states bound by common culture and mutual defense, but for most of its history wasn’t truly a unified nation and the Chessentan cities were often at war with one another. Chessenta was one of the so-called [[Old Empires]] of [[Faerûn]].

{{Quote|Chessenta is a mosaic of a nation that was made by ten different artists, all of them blindfolded|[[Heptios]], mage of [[Cimbar]].}}

Culture.Cuisine: During Chessentan celebrations of the [[Deadwinter Day]], the realm's people prepared confections known as [[Skull (food)|skull]]s. Small decadent fatty and sweet dough balls were pinned to form a rough shape of a skull, cooked, and covered in white sugar icing.{{Cite web/theedverse/2022-09-27 - Traditional Holiday Confectionary}}

document_data.Religion:
After the Spellplague, [[Amaunator]] gained many followers who saw him as the ancient Untherian god [[Hokatep]] returned to [[Faerûn]].  As Chessenta was a martial society, [[Tempus]] had many followers. [[Oghma]] had a large temple in [[Erebos]] and, since [[Kelemvor]] had almost no presence in the region, the temple of [[Waukeen]] assumed responsibility for tending to the dead.{{Cite dungeon/178/Backdrop: Chessenta}}

In addition to the common Faerûnian religions there were several regional cults.  The [[Cult of Tchazzar]] always had a large membership in Chessenta and with Tchazzar's return the cult was been reinvigorated and was building a huge temple in Luthcheq in 1479 DR.  The Cult of [[Entropy]] worshiped the [[primordial]] [[Entropy]] and a cult worshiped the archfey [[Sebakar]], the Lord of Crocodiles.

Bodies of Water.Bay of Chessenta: With the drop in the water level of the [[Sea of Fallen Stars|Sea of Fallen Stars,]] this shallow bay all but dried up.
Bodies of Water.Adder Swamp: When the Bay of Chessenta dried up the swamp expanded to cover most of the Bay's western coast. It was home to the [[lycanthrope]] nation of [[Sebakar (nation)|Sebakar]].{{Cite dungeon/178/Backdrop: Chessenta|72}}

Mountains.Riders to the Sky: A range of hills and mountains that was the domain of [[troll]]s and [[duergar]].

Other.Maw of the God Swallower: This area of [[plagueland]] in south-central Chessenta continues to grow, swallowing everything in its path.  In its center, the [[primordial]] [[Entropy]] hangs over the landscape.

Cities and Towns.Akanax: This large city was in essence a large military camp.
Cities and Towns.Cimbar: In ruins as of the 15{{th}} century DR, this was the largest city and the spiritual capital of Chessenta in the pre-Spellplague era.
Cities and Towns.City of the Werecrocodiles: A settlement of [[werecrocodile]]s located in the Adder Swamp.
Cities and Towns.Erebos: Large city in the northwest. A temple of Tiamat stood near the sea.
Cities and Towns.Heptios (city)|Heptios: A former city-state of 9,000 now under the dominion of Chessenta.
Cities and Towns.Luthcheq: The City of Madness was ruled by [[Tchazzar]].  It was formerly ruled by the Karanok family, all of whom were members of the [[Cult of Entropy]].
Cities and Towns.Mordulkin: A city on the eastern side of the Bay of Chessenta. Ruled for a long time by the [[Jedea]] family and a haven for wizards.
Cities and Towns.Pandrik: Fortress city of 6,500 souls situated near the Adder Swap. It had a precarious treaty with Luthcheq.
Cities and Towns.Soolabax: A large town near the border with Threskel.
Cities and Towns.Soorenar: In ruins as of the 15{{th}} century DR, this was a powerful metropolis in the pre-Spellplague era.
Cities and Towns.Toreus: Grew significantly after the Spellplague to become Chessenta's third largest city with a population of 17,000.
Cities and Towns.Tulach: Situation just east of the [[Maerwatch]]. Despite its small size (population of 1,100), Tulach had its own monarch.

document_data.Navy and Seafaring: Chessentan vessels were named after sea creatures or sea-related myths.
